revised_title: Effects of Hypophysectomy on Spermatogenesis in Ferrets
tldr: The study investigates the effects of hypophysectomy on the reproductive system of male ferrets. It shows that hypophysectomy causes the testes to regress to the anoestrous condition within a month, characterized by a decrease in testis weight and aspermatogenesis. The epididymis also shows similar atrophy. The experimental regression is about three times faster than the normal decline into anoestrous.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
